title: Chinese Embassy of Senegal delivers Guangzhou Municipal Government's donation of COVID medical supplies to the Dakar Municipal Government
description: On June 30, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Senegal and the Dakar Municipal Government held a handover ceremony to celebrate the arrival of anti-COVID-19 supplies donated by the municipal government of Guangzhou, China. The aid will go to support Dakar's "Million Masks" campaign.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Embassy of Senegal delivers Guangzhou Municipal Government's donation of COVID medical supplies to the Dakar Municipal Government

# Description
On June 30, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Senegal and the Dakar Municipal Government held a handover ceremony to celebrate the arrival of anti-COVID-19 supplies donated by the municipal government of Guangzhou, China. The aid will go to support Dakar's "Million Masks" campaign.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for public health purposes, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: COVID-19 medical supplies donation, public health focus, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: CIDCA and MOFCOM donates second batch of COVID-19 relief supplies to Senegal in April 2020
description: On April 20, 2020, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and China International Development Cooperation Agency donated the second batch of COVID-19 relief supplies to Senegal and held a handover ceremony with the Senegalese Ministry of Health and Social Action on April 22. The shipment included 1,750 N95 masks, 10,000 surgical masks, 1,750 disposable coveralls, 350 infrared thermometers, 1,750 protection glasses, 9,750 pairs of disposable nitrile gloves, and 9,750 pairs of disposable shoe covers. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:

# Description
On April 20, 2020, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and China International Development Cooperation Agency donated the second batch of COVID-19 relief supplies to Senegal and held a handover ceremony with the Senegalese Ministry of Health and Social Action on April 22. The shipment included 1,750 N95 masks, 10,000 surgical masks, 1,750 disposable coveralls, 350 infrared thermometers, 1,750 protection glasses, 9,750 pairs of disposable nitrile gloves, and 9,750 pairs of disposable shoe covers. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support and COVID-19 relief, with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of medical supplies including masks, protective equipment, and thermometers for COVID-19 relief

title: China donates $1 million to UNICEF to help combat pediatric malnutrition in Senegal as a part of their COVID-19 response
description: On March 11, 2020, the Government of China committed to donate USD 1,000,000 to the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) to fight pediatric malnutrition in Senegal during the Covid-19 Pandemic. The donation was completed by November 3, 2020 and intended to benefit 17,355 children under the age of five in north and east Senegal including the regions of Diourbel, Louga, Matam, Tambacounda and Saint Louis. The COVID-19 pandemic has increased the risk of malnutrition among children in Senegal due to the deterioration in the quality of their food, lack of access to nutrition and other health care services, and the shocks caused by the pandemic.
combined_text:

# Title

# Description
On March 11, 2020, the Government of China committed to donate USD 1,000,000 to the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) to fight pediatric malnutrition in Senegal during the Covid-19 Pandemic. The donation was completed by November 3, 2020 and intended to benefit 17,355 children under the age of five in north and east Senegal including the regions of Diourbel, Louga, Matam, Tambacounda and Saint Louis. The COVID-19 pandemic has increased the risk of malnutrition among children in Senegal due to the deterioration in the quality of their food, lack of access to nutrition and other health care services, and the shocks caused by the pandemic.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation focused on health and nutrition, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation to UNICEF for pediatric malnutrition, health sector focus, COVID-19 response

title: Chinese Embassy in Senegal donates 1,590,000 CFA to the Fédération Sénégalaise de Kung Fu Wushu (FSKW)
description: On June 11, 2020, the Chinese Ambassador Senegal, Xiao Han, presented the Fédération Sénégalaise de Kung Fu Wushu (FSKW) with a donation of 1,590,000 West African Francs to further support Wushu in Senegal. The donation was made in anticipation of the 2026 Dakar Youth Olympics and to spread the influence of martial arts in Senegal.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Embassy in Senegal donates 1,590,000 CFA to the Fédération Sénégalaise de Kung Fu Wushu (FSKW)

# Description
On June 11, 2020, the Chinese Ambassador Senegal, Xiao Han, presented the Fédération Sénégalaise de Kung Fu Wushu (FSKW) with a donation of 1,590,000 West African Francs to further support Wushu in Senegal. The donation was made in anticipation of the 2026 Dakar Youth Olympics and to spread the influence of martial arts in Senegal.
justification: Project is a social development initiative focused on cultural exchange and sports development
evidence: Donation to martial arts federation, cultural/sports focus, no direct energy or environmental impact

title: Chinese Government donates Covid-19 relief supplies to the Senegalese Ministry of Health and Social Action in July 2020
description: On July 3, 2020, the Chinese Government donated Covid-19 relief supplies to the Senegalese Ministry of Health and Social Action. The donation included 10,032 testing reagents,10,000 sets of protective clothing, 15,000 pairs of goggles, and 20,000 N95 Masks, 15,000 pairs of gloves, 3,000 pairs of shoe covers and 350,000 surgical masks and other medical supplies. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   This donation is comprised of two parts. The first, which contains the majority of the supplies donated, is the third batch of supplies donated by the Chinese government. The second comprises 20,000 surgical masks and is donated China Road and Bridge Senegal Corporation. After the handover ceremony was completed, representatives from the two sides signed the intergovernmental handover certificate for the third batch of anti-epidemic goods.
staff_comments: 1. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.2. Added China Road and Bridge Corporation as a Co-Financing Agency as they funded the second part of this grant. AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:

title: Jiangsu Provincial Construction (JPC) Group donates anti-pandemic materials to Senegal's Diamniadio Children's Hospital in June 2020
description: On June 19, 2020, Jiangsu Provincial Construction (JPC) Group donated anti-pandemic materials to Diamniadio Children's Hospital in Senegal. The donation included surgical masks, protective clothing, goggles, biological microscopes, three-channel electrocardiogram machines, bedside monitors, and syphgmomanometers, among other pieces of medical equipment. The exact amount and monetary value of the donation is unknown. During the handover ceremony, Gong Zhen, the leader of the third technical assistance project team of the Children's Hospital, and Mam Gay, the director of the Hospital were present.   The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese name of the hospital is 贾姆尼亚贾儿童医院.

title: China Eximbank provides EUR 164.6 million buyer’s credit loan for 29.18 km Obrenovac-Novi Beograd Heating Pipeline Project
description: On June 7, 2017, the Chinese Government and the Government of Serbia signed a Memorandum of Understanding on the 29.18 km Obrenovac-Novi Beograd Heating Pipeline Project. Then, on January 17, 2020, China Eximbank and the Government of the Republic of Serbia signed an EUR 164,685,800 buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreement [ID#1420313022020210056] for the 29.18 km Obrenovac-Novi Beograd Heating Pipeline Project. The National Assembly of Serbia ratified the loan agreement in February 2020.   The loan (BCL) carries the following borrowing terms: a 15-year maturity, a 3-year grace period, interest rate of 6-month EURIBOR plus a 2.7% margin, a 2% default (penalty) interest rate, a 0.5% commitment fee, a 0.5% (EUR 823,429) management fee, and an EUR 12,208,102.49 Sinosure insurance premium. The proceeds of the loan (BCL) are to be used by the borrower to finance 85% of the cost of an EUR 193,748,000 commercial (EPC) contract between Public Utility Company "Beogradske elektrane”, the City of Belgrade, and Power Construction Corporation of China (PowerChina), which was signed on November 27, 2017 and amended on July 9, 2019.   The lender made disbursements worth EUR 32,937,000 ($37,265,000) in 2021. The loan’s (principal) amount outstanding was $0 as of December 31, 2020, EUR 32,937,000 ($37,265,000) as of December 31, 2021, and EUR 32,937,000 ($32,321,000) as of September 31, 2022.    The purpose of the project is to construct a 29.18 km heating pipeline (heat transmission line) — with heat transfer capacity of 800MW — that connects the Termoelektrane Nikola Tesla (TENT) power plant near the city municipality of Obrenovac (exact locational coordinates: 44.65461414707668, 20.004822111741095) and the Novi Beograd (New Belgrade) thermal power plant (exact locational coordinates: 44.8005, 20.4099). The project also involves the construction of four pumping stations. The project will seek to use hot water, which is currently discharged from a power plant into the Sava river, for heating purposes. Upon completion, the heating pipeline is expected to generate annual savings of about EUR 43 million, or roughly one third of the EUR 140 million that the Belgrade district heating company spends on natural gas imports each year.   Power Construction Corporation of China (PowerChina) is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation.  Construction was originally scheduled to commence in June 2021. However, as of January 2022, AidData could not identify any evidence that construction had commenced. Some sources seems to suggest that the COVID-19 pandemic has led to implementation delays. There is, however, evidence that some preliminary (pre-construction) activities have taken place, such as land expropriation.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 塞尔维亚奥布雷诺瓦茨至贝尔格莱德新区供热管道建设项目 or 塞尔维亚奥布雷诺瓦兹至贝尔格莱德新区供热管道建设项目. The Serbian project title is Пројекат изградње топловода Обреновац - Нови Београд. 2. AidData estimated the all-in interest rate (2.37%) by adding a 2.7% margin to the average 6-month EURIBOR rate in January 2020 (-0.330%). 3. The China Eximbank BCL (loan) agreement [ID#1420313022020210056] can be accessed in its entirety via https://www.dropbox.com/s/gjrlmg2c8e8f55w/China%20Eximbank%20loan%20agreement%20for%20Construction%20of%20District%20Heating%20Pipeline%20Project%20Obrenovac-Novi%20Beograd.pdf?dl=0
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
China Eximbank provides EUR 164.6 million buyer’s credit loan for 29.18 km Obrenovac-Novi Beograd Heating Pipeline Project

# Description
On June 7, 2017, the Chinese Government and the Government of Serbia signed a Memorandum of Understanding on the 29.18 km Obrenovac-Novi Beograd Heating Pipeline Project. Then, on January 17, 2020, China Eximbank and the Government of the Republic of Serbia signed an EUR 164,685,800 buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreement [ID#1420313022020210056] for the 29.18 km Obrenovac-Novi Beograd Heating Pipeline Project. The National Assembly of Serbia ratified the loan agreement in February 2020.   The loan (BCL) carries the following borrowing terms: a 15-year maturity, a 3-year grace period, interest rate of 6-month EURIBOR plus a 2.7% margin, a 2% default (penalty) interest rate, a 0.5% commitment fee, a 0.5% (EUR 823,429) management fee, and an EUR 12,208,102.49 Sinosure insurance premium. The proceeds of the loan (BCL) are to be used by the borrower to finance 85% of the cost of an EUR 193,748,000 commercial (EPC) contract between Public Utility Company "Beogradske elektrane”, the City of Belgrade, and Power Construction Corporation of China (PowerChina), which was signed on November 27, 2017 and amended on July 9, 2019.   The lender made disbursements worth EUR 32,937,000 ($37,265,000) in 2021. The loan’s (principal) amount outstanding was $0 as of December 31, 2020, EUR 32,937,000 ($37,265,000) as of December 31, 2021, and EUR 32,937,000 ($32,321,000) as of September 31, 2022.    The purpose of the project is to construct a 29.18 km heating pipeline (heat transmission line) — with heat transfer capacity of 800MW — that connects the Termoelektrane Nikola Tesla (TENT) power plant near the city municipality of Obrenovac (exact locational coordinates: 44.65461414707668, 20.004822111741095) and the Novi Beograd (New Belgrade) thermal power plant (exact locational coordinates: 44.8005, 20.4099). The project also involves the construction of four pumping stations. The project will seek to use hot water, which is currently discharged from a power plant into the Sava river, for heating purposes. Upon completion, the heating pipeline is expected to generate annual savings of about EUR 43 million, or roughly one third of the EUR 140 million that the Belgrade district heating company spends on natural gas imports each year.   Power Construction Corporation of China (PowerChina) is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation.  Construction was originally scheduled to commence in June 2021. However, as of January 2022, AidData could not identify any evidence that construction had commenced. Some sources seems to suggest that the COVID-19 pandemic has led to implementation delays. There is, however, evidence that some preliminary (pre-construction) activities have taken place, such as land expropriation.
justification: The project primarily involves the construction of a heating pipeline and pumping stations, which is general infrastructure with no clear direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: 29.18 km heating pipeline, four pumping stations, heat transfer capacity of 800MW, connects power plants

title: Chinese medical team arrives in Serbia with anti-epidemic donations in March 2020
description: On March 21st, 2020, a six-member Chinese medical team with experience fighting COVID-19 arrived in Belgrade, Serbia. The doctors brought ventilators, medical masks, test kits, and other supplies in the first batch of 16 tons of donations to Serbia. Three rotating members of the Medical Expert Group were awarded the military's highest-level commemorative medals by Serbian Defense Minister Wu Lin on June 1st, 2020. The purpose of this donation is to help Serbia fight against the pandemic.  On June 11th, 2020, the medical team left Serbia, completing the project.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese medical team arrives in Serbia with anti-epidemic donations in March 2020

# Description
On March 21st, 2020, a six-member Chinese medical team with experience fighting COVID-19 arrived in Belgrade, Serbia. The doctors brought ventilators, medical masks, test kits, and other supplies in the first batch of 16 tons of donations to Serbia. Three rotating members of the Medical Expert Group were awarded the military's highest-level commemorative medals by Serbian Defense Minister Wu Lin on June 1st, 2020. The purpose of this donation is to help Serbia fight against the pandemic.  On June 11th, 2020, the medical team left Serbia, completing the project.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support and pandemic response, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical team, ventilators, medical masks, test kits, and other supplies provided for pandemic response

title: China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC) donates medical supplies to the Serbian Embassy in China in March 2020
description: On March 23, 2020, the China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC) donated medical supplies to the Embassy of Serbia in Beijing. This donation included 5,000 medical masks and 20 pieces of PPE. The purpose of this donation is to help Serbia fight against the pandemic. The exact monetary value of this donation is unknown.   Wang Lijun, the Deputy General Manager of CRBC, met with Milan Bačević, the Serbian Ambassador to China,  at the Embassy of Serbia in Beijing and officially handed over the supplies to the embassy.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
